meanings.definition: A stopper for the hole in a cask or barrel.
meanings.sent1: The bung kept the liquid from spilling out of the barrel.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to remove the bung before pouring the contents of the cask.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the bung, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like a bung sealing away the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bung, like a faithful guardian, protected the precious contents of the barrel.

meanings.definition: To close or seal with a bung.
meanings.sent1: He had to bung up the leak in the pipe to stop the water from dripping.
meanings.sent2: Remember to bung the bottle tightly to keep the freshness of the drink.
meanings.sent3: She tried to bung the door with a chair, but it didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: The music bunged up her ears, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The chef hurried to bung the pot to prevent the soup from boiling over.
